summary: This bill, the Incorporating National Support for Unprecedented Risks and Emergencies Act (INSURE Act), establishes a federal catastrophic property loss reinsurance program. The program provides reinsurance for primary insurance companies, covering perils like wind, hurricane, wildfire, severe convective storms, flood, and potentially earthquake. It outlines program eligibility, includes provisions for program phase-in, premiums, and an advisory committee, as well as the creation of a Federal Catastrophe Reinsurance Fund. The bill also mandates reports on a relocation fund and earthquake coverage, and establishes a pilot program for multi-year property insurance policies.
